valid_articles.Title: And... it's confirmed. Again, big changes right when the August core update is rolling out. AIOs for users not logged in, and AIOS expanding to 6 more countries. Good luck out there. :)
valid_articles.Description: Tweet from @glenngabe confirming significant changes in Google Search, including the rollout of AI Overviews for users not logged in and expansion to new countries, coinciding with the August core update.

valid_articles.Title: Google confirmed with me just now they are showing AI Overviews in the US for signed-out users

valid_articles.Title: Of course, this seems to be rolling out right when the August core update rolls out. And, AI Overviews are expanding to 6 more countries too. And all of this can impact your visibility, clicks from Search, etc. Again, "Welcome To Google Land." :)
valid_articles.Description: Tweet from @glenngabe highlighting the impact of Google's updates, including the rollout of AI Overviews for logged-out users and expansion to new countries, coinciding with the August core update, and how these changes can affect website visibility and traffic.

valid_articles.Title: I just reproduced this. It's a big deal, since AI Overviews were not triggering when not logged in. Now they are (at least for some) -> Google Tests AI Overviews In Incognito Mode (Not Signed In)

valid_articles.Title: Google brings AI answers in Search to new countries
valid_articles.Description: Google parent Alphabet said on Thursday it was expanding its AI-generated summaries for search queries to six new countries, just two months after it rolled back some capabilities following a problem-riddled launch.  The search giant made AI Overviews - which are displayed atop a search results page before traditional links to the Web - available to all U.S. users in May after spending one year trialing a limited earlier version.  The feature was widely panned after screenshots of factually inaccurate answers circulated across the internet, such as a pizza recipe that listed glue as an ingredient and an answer claiming that former U.S. President Barack Obama is Muslim.
